About myself

Hi, I’m Xindi Wang, a Network Science PhD student at the Center for Complex Network Research in Network Science Institute, Northeastern University.

My research is mostly about complex systems, especially from data-driven and network science point of view. Currently, I’m working with Prof Albert-László Barabási and Prof Tina Eliassi-Rad on Success of Books and Authors.

First try

Hello hello hello! my first webpage! exciting!

Success of Books and Authors

I'm currently working on a project *Success of Books and Authors* in collaboration with Burcu Yucesoy, Onur Varol, Prof Tina Eliassi-Rad and Prof Albert-László Barabási. We are interested in why some books and authors become successful. We recently published our first paper in this project in *EPJ Data Science*. We analzed the *New York Times* Bestseller data and found a lot of interesting pattern in it. We also have an interactive visualization website and it's fun to play with! - Check [our paper](https://epjdatascience.springeropen.com/articles/10.1140/epjds/s13688-018-0135-y) - Check the [visualizations](http://bestsellers.barabasilab.com)! We are currently working on the prediction of book sales prior to the publication of a book. I have shown part of our results at various conferences: - CompleNet'18. You can find my [presentation](xindi-dumbledore.github.io/_includes/myfiles/LearningToPlace_final.pdf) here! - NetSciX'18. You can find my [presentation](xindi-dumbledore.github.io/_includes/myfiles/LearningToPlace_final.pdf) here! - NetSci'17
